results.title: Bush Christmas
results.creator_credit: ABFD, Children's Entertainment Films and Ralph Smart
results.brief_description: This brilliant Australian film depicts Yuletide life in country Australia in the 1940s. A family of children, whose father owns a horse farm, realise the horses have been stolen, so they set out to track the horse thieves in an effort to return the horses to their father as a Christmas present. A storm destroys their tracks and the children become lost, while search parties, and the horse thieves, one of which is played by Chips Rafferty, desperately hunt for them. This is a superb film which won critical acclaim around the world upon its release, and is regarded as an Australian classic. Narrated by John McCallum and filmed on location in the Blue Mountains and Burragorang Valley. Cast includes: John Fernside, Stan Tolhurst, Helen Grieve, Nicky Yardly, Edmund Allison.

results.title: Bush Christmas
results.creator_credit: Barron Films, Gilda Baracchi, Paul D. Barron and Henri Safran
results.brief_description: It’s nearly Christmas and a group of children embark on a courageous and exciting adventure to rescue their stolen horse in time to take part in the big country race on New Year’s Day. This timeless story is a wonderful Australian film filled with adventure, comedy and a dash of romance. Stars Nicole Kidman and John Howard.

results.title: Bus Stop
results.creator_credit: Buddy Adler, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Joshua Logan
results.brief_description: A naive, young cowboy coming to Phoenix for the big rodeo, falls in love with the first woman he sees. She happens to be Marilyn Monroe, playing a “chantoosie” in a cheap bar, and he has to almost kidnap her, get beaten up for her, and perform majestically in the rodeo before she reciprocates his love. Don Murray gives a boisterous performance as the cowboy in the big city, but Monroe steals the film in what is considered one of her best performances. Based on the play “Bus Stop” by William Inge.

results.title: Bus stop
results.brief_description:
This animation employs a fearless use of monochrome to enhance its sophisticated intertextual referencing of classic cartoons. The original music both supports and acts as a counterpoint to the storyline.
‘Fast lane’ performed by Lucid.

results.title: Bus people
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Nicole Bloom and ACMI
results.brief_description: When you’re poor, there’s nothing as important as finding food. Nicole Bloom movingly recalls her distressing time on the streets, amongst the poor people of Melbourne, when riding on the bus is a luxury.
results.creator_credit_for_label: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Nicole Bloom and ACMI

results.title: Burwood Teachers' College
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Visual Education Centre, E.J. Perry and Gil Brealey
results.brief_description: A teacher is a person skilled in the ways of imparting knowledge to their pupils, and at the Burwood Teachers’ College, we see students developing these skills. Many of them live in comfortable hostels where they are made to feel at home in a bright atmosphere. The happy relationship between lecturers and students is evident. A number of students are assisted by bursaries, and all receive a regular allowance. Debates on current affairs, discussion and drama groups, woodwork, sewing and other media, and sports of all kinds are valuable supplements to the normal course of lectures. The students are taught to think clearly and to express themselves confidently. Observation and teaching in schools are important practical aspects of training the students to uderstand children and to maintain discipline. Visits to provincial colleges, meeting future colleagues, preparing assignments, the ratings for their certificates, the final graduation ceremony and the appointments to their first schools are other features of this film produced by the Visual Education Centre.

results.title: Burt Dow, deep-water man (K)
results.creator_credit: Kratky Film, Weston Woods Studios, Zdenka Deitchova, Morton Schindel and Vaclav Bedrich
results.brief_description: An animated film of adventure in the high seas. When Burt Dow, a retired seaman, sets sail in his boat the Tidley-Idley to fish for cod, he ends up inside a whale. The whale refuses to let Burt leave, so Burt dreams up a uniquely artistic solution. Based on the book by Robert McCloskey. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Burroughs
results.creator_credit: Citifilm Works, Howard Brookner and Alan Yentob
results.brief_description: William Burroughs, the noted American novelist, is the subject of this documentary filmed over five years and including material shot earlier, in black and white, by British film director, Antony Balch. In cinema verite style, director Howard Brookner shows Burroughs as a private person reminiscing about his inspirations and exploits. Writers and reviewers appearing in this film include Alan Ginsberg and Jack Kerouac. Contents include: Reel 1 - Nova Express, the Place of Dead Roads, Cities of the Red Night, The Wild Boys, Naked Lunch Reel 2 - Naked Lunch, Nova Express Reel 3 - The Place of Dead Roads

results.title: Burra, South Australia
results.brief_description: A film on the copper mining carried out at Burra in the early 1800’s. Historic buildings are shown, as are pump houses and ventilation chimneys built on the copper fields by the Cornish and Welshmen. Photography by Ron Horner.
results.description: A film on the copper mining carried out at Burra in the early 1800’s. Historic buildings are shown, as are pump houses and ventilation chimneys built on the copper fields by the Cornish and Welshmen. Photography by Ron Horner.
